intro: Gnaphaliothamnus sartorii, commonly known as the Sartor's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it survive in dry conditions. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
